content.text:
# Draft:Historical Society of Southern California

California Historical Society Quarterly and HSSC should link here
Historical Society of Southern California (HSSC) is a historical society in Southern California founded in 1883. It published the Southern California Quarterly until 2023, as well as a newsletter and books. Until 2014, they were based in the historic Lummis House.
Valentine Mott Porter's General Stephen W. Kearny and the conquest of California, 1846-7 about Stephen W. Kearny was published by the group in 1911.
It has a collection of newspapers.
Civil War veteran, gold
miner, educator, and school official James Miller Guinn (1837-1918) A. M. was Secretary and President of the Historical Society of Southern California and edited its publication.
Henry Dwight Barrows was active in it.
Lowell E. Hardy edited the Quarterly in 1943.
